medical_history.chief_complaint: Recurrent episodes of angioedema involving legs or hands.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was diagnosed with type I hereditary angioedema (HAE) at the age of 49 years. She experienced episodes of angioedema once every 2â€“3 months but had not experienced an edema attack for the past year prior to the surgery. Four weeks after surgery, she reported edema alternating between her left and right feet every 10 days. By week 8 of outpatient follow-up, she no longer experienced edema.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Type I hereditary angioedema (HAE) diagnosed at age 49.
